Who is gonna do the running David Cobb bishop Sankey who is garbage jalston Fowler a rookie maybe Antonio Andrews or Dexter?  Better improve the ground game somehow
I gotta a feeling are running game ain't gonna do work and help Mariota they should just sign ray rice imo straight up

Nick Chubbs!!!!! Drafting Nick Chubbs next year no matter how early or how much we need to move up to get him is how we fix the run game and then some. Then we could run over any team with the guy I believe will turn out to be the best RB in the NFL. He was just as good as Todd Gurley as a freshman and will turn out better than Gurley who is an elite RB. Nick Chubbs is also a lot more durable. We need to make sure we get RB Nick Chubb from the Georgia Bulldogs next year in the draft no matter how soon we have to draft him or go up and get him. He would help Mariota tremendously and can carry this team on his back just like he carries the Georgia Bulldogs on his back. He can keep our defense off the field and fresh. The best defense is a great offense. We could score, run the clock down, and have so many weapons with Chubbs added to the team. I think with Chubbs along with our new additions this year and a few free agent additions we could go head to head with almost any team and possibly every team with Chubbs at RB to help our QB, and Chubbs is hard to bring down and draws 8 man boxes, which opens the passing lanes while preventing a fully committed pass rush bc Chubbs demands that elite respect to where you can't just ignore the run game. Our other RB's would compliment him well too. RB Nick Chubbs would be the one addition over everybody else that would help this team. You got to score points now! If Gurley stays healthy who runs just like Chubbs and who Chubbs took over for when Gurley got hurt, Gurley will run the Rams into the playoffs each year on his back. Chubbs is younger and more durable, and got better while doing just as good of job at RB for Georgia last year. In my opinion Chubbs will be the better RB and the best in the league, and Gurley will be a close behind him if he stays healthy. Plus they both can pass catch. An elite RB helps the team in all areas and on both sides of the ball. It isn't often these type of backs come along and especially in back to back years. We have to get Chubbs next year since we needed to and had to make Mariota our priority this year and rightfully so. Outside a QB, no other player can do more for the team on either side of the ball than an elite bell cow RB, and Nick Chubbs is that RB that automatically makes your team and defense better, and is a building we need immediately bc of all that he adds. With Mariota and Chubbs playing together, along with what DGB adds to the equation, it will draw players and free agents to want to play for the Titans bc they would be a top offense which will help the defense. After Chubbs we can work on the defense and have an elite team that other teams will respect and fear to play.
Worst case scenario our running game will be lead by Super Mariota Kart
We need a veteran running back to help our young backs out.

All I know is that we can't release Hunter until he has played a full season with Mariota. He could turn out to be an elite receiver with Mariota throwing the ball to him since Mariota is extremely accurate. Maybe this last incident will cause him to grow up and focus on football. That would help the Titans and Mariota if he gets focused and realizes he could have messed his career up, and that he isn't good like he thinks he is right now. He has the potential to be and we can't lose someone who could become elite and a playmaker, especially after trading up for him in the 2nd round in 2013. We need great WR. Hopefully this will clear his head and cause him to focus fully on football. If he can not become an extraction and not cause problems for the team, he could become an elite weapon and problem for defenses with our other receivers now. The Titans can't afford to lose talent and give talent to other teams and then what should be our own guys help beat us. Now with some focus and studying while concentrating solely on football he has the chance to regain his elite form from previous college and preseason years and use his elite physique and talent he has to be that elite playmaker he was drafted to be. Also if he focuses on football like he definitely should now and becomes the elite receiver the he can become, it will allow the Titans to get him at a highly discounted price with his previous non-focus hurting his performance and his off-field issues hiring his value. This can turn out to help the Titans in a huge way and help a talented and young WR get his life back on track. The Titans need to provide mentors for guys with troubled backgrounds and those who are not focused as they should be. That program would help the Titans a lot. Some of the best teams draft talented players that others wouldn't take bc of issues and help them get focused and end up with elite talent at a bargain.

A new stadium sponsor, a new potential "franchise" QB, a new head coach, a new defensive system. This is THE time for the Titans to create a new brand image. They have failed to create a successful team for many years, but they have also failed at creating a true "franchise" image. Most people, even many true fans don't get what the Titans are, and I don't just mean in the literal sense. This would be THE YEAR to release a whole new image. A new/updated logo, mascot, and uniforms. They need an entire overhaul of the brand because it's just not working.

To Nissan North America and Tennessee Titans, As a fan of the Titans I was delighted to hear that Nissan would be purchasing the naming rights to our riverside home. Tennessee takes great pride in being the home of Nissan's production facility and North American HQ. The merge of two great icons in Tennessee is a naturally great decision for all parties involved: Nissan, the Titan's organization, but also fans of both franchises. However, the name of our football home is one thing we hold in great regard. And with the extended period the naming rights are rumored to be, we fans feel our voice needs to be heard on the matter. As you may or may not know, the Titans are named in reflection of a long held nickname of Nashville, The Athens of the South. This can be viewed within the city through the classical architecture, its culture, the education brought by institutions such as Belmont and Vanderbilt, but most evidently (another result of Nashville's nickname) a replica of the Parthenon containing Athena originally constructed in 1897. It is due to these thematic memes throughout the city that we humbly request our football home to be named "Nissan Coliseum." Beyond the obvious Athens theme, we feel "Nissan Coliseum" is better suited for a number of reasons listed below.
Nissan has connection to the theme with the Titan Truck. A powerful heroic truck and team deserve a name that reflects their traits.
"Nissan Stadium" lacks the creativity and innovation that has driven both Nashville and Nissan.
"Nissan Coliseum" sounds better and rolls of the tongue better than "Nissan Stadium"
There is already a "Nissan Stadium" in Yokohama, Japan. We would like to avoid any confusion between the two.

data.name: Marcus Mariota Focused on Learning Offense

data.message:
Mariota is our hope for the Titans franchise, and better hope for the NFL. NFL getting bashed with players being in court, or jail, or rehab. I feel like Mariota is the face of the NFL, not just Titans. He is wanting to learn the offense and transition. He may not win SB this year, but he will damn sure prove he has what it takes to be in the league. His teammates already talking about his quickness, and deadly accuracy, shows he is a leader. I am pleased to see a prospect in such a long time driven to play a sport their compassionate about and Mariota has proven that in college and his NFL OTAs, minicamps, and interviews. The seasons needs to begin.

Go Titans! 8 Mariota

He's a class act all the way around. As a Duck fan I've watched how quickly he has came along. A very smart man who is cold as ice under pressure. He throws lasers! I live nowhere near Tennessee but am such a fan of Mariota that I had to get the Sunday ticket just to watch the reaction of Titan fans who may not realize what a special talent this guy is on and of the field. Doubters beware, this man studies and works harder than any quarterback I've ever seen. His vacation will be filled with book work I guarantee it! He will show up in shape with a firm grip on the playbook and yes he can take a three step drop!
I hope this year the Titans will be a team that all teams feared playing in the past seasons.

data.name: เฉลิมกิติ จักรพันธุ์

data.message: Tre McBride should definitely make the team and become the #4 receiver behind Dorial Green-Beckham, Wright, and Douglas. Hakeem Nicks should probably be waived instead of risking losing McBride to another team due to Nicks 1 year contract, and Nicks hasn't performed very well lately. I think McBride was one of the biggest steals of the draft, and he had a 4th round grade at worst. He should definitely make the team and he was a big star at his college, and it's been said that he has the best hands out of the entire draft. We definitely need a polished receiver with great hands who is also quick and fast, and those attributes describe Tre McBride. I'm excited about McBride and Green-Beckham, and can't wait to see them help our team in a big way!
